Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent quiet location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: pabstraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights between dec 27th- 29th. I had a Room in the second floor which face the Grossowstrasse. It was really quiet, and i was able to sleep very well without ear plugs. the bed and pillow were really comfortable. there is a manual safe deposit and you can lock it with the set of keys you receive when you check in. The room and bathroom were super clean! I paid 33 euros for each night including the breakfast. Nollendorfplatz station its very close, bars/clubs/restaurants in the area but hte grossowstrasse its very quiet/residential. The wifi worked without problems. the room and bed can feel a bit packed, but you have everything you need. My friends (a couple) stayed in another room in the first (reception) floor. Theyre bed were two single beds together so in wasnt very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “good value - friendly staff - super location”
Reviews.Author: OdieUK
Reviews.Content: 9/9-12/9 - Weekend break stay in connection with a street fair. Hotel based in quiet location above a supermarket close to the Schoneberg gay scene without being right in the middle - close to a number of good restaurants/cafes etc. Ubahn station at Nollendorfplatz is within walking distance - and bus-stop 3 min walk for M46 goes to Zoogarten (connections to Tegel Airport buses). Room was large and comfortable with modern furniture - shower room a bit small (could do with better lighting) but perfectly adequate. hotel reception was very helpful over various requests for information. if the free inroom wifi is not working fast - there is free internet next to the reception desk. breakfast is extra at 6.50 euros - usual European style breakast including hot n cold items. overall a good hotel - good quiet location - at a reasonable cost

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Friendly staff, AWESOME location!”
Reviews.Author: Ido K
Reviews.Content: Everything was just great. the rooms are not so big for a couple and the wifi is not working fluently, apart of that it was cheap and very convinient.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Glenmere7
Reviews.Content: The Good: The location in a quiet residential area within walking distance of the U-bahn was very attractive (I used the station at Nollendorfplatz). Hotel Ambiente is close to the Schöneberg gay scene without being an intentional part of that scene. There are lots of nice restaurants, pubs and cafés nearby, especially in Winterfeldtstr., Eisenacherstr., Motzstr. and Maaßenstr. The staff was friendly and helpful. Upon arrival I was given a good map of the area. The receptionist accommodated my luggage when I arrived early and for a few hours after I checked out. I spoke only German with the staff, so I cannot comment on their English language proficiency. The room was not large (about 15 x 13 ft., excluding the bath), but space is organized very efficiently, and it was clean and well appointed, including a small refrigerator. As an example of space efficiency, the single chair in the room can be placed at the mini-fridge, so that its wooden top becomes a table or desk. The small television is mounted 7 feet high in a corner, and if you wish to watch TV, there is an additional deposit required for the remote control. (I didn’t bother.) A large window provides plenty of natural light. I was not bothered by noise from outside or inside the hotel, except of course for the unavoidable Sunday morning Glockenspiel emanating from the city’s church spires. I’ve had more comfortable beds, but it’s typical in Germany not to have a double mattress or box springs, and the mattress was plush enough to give me a good recovery from jet lag. There are two very convenient wall sconce reading lamps above the double bed, each with its own control. The bath was a decent size with clean modern fixtures, including a shower cabinet (no tub). Hot water was prompt and plentiful, and the towels are of good quality, though I wish they were a bit larger. I also appreciated that the reception desk is not directly located on the stair landing or in direct view of the hotel entrance, rather separated from the stairway by a door at the landing one floor up from street level. While a receptionist was available 24 hours a day, it is also nice not to be constantly observed when coming or going. A computer with internet connection is available to guests free of charge in the lobby area. The breakfast buffet is optional for an extra charge, and I appreciated having that price flexibility. The breakfast is quite good, including hot and cold items as well as fresh fruit and is provided in a large sunny room with white table cloths. I found it worth the additional 6.50 euros per day that I was charged; however, if you wish to save on food expenses, there are less expensive breakfast options at nearby stand-up cafés and bakeries, e.g. in the Winterfeldtstr. At other times you might wish to purchase a few items from the Penny Markt grocery next door to the hotel. Penny Markt sells fresh produce, some packaged deli items, wine and beer. The Bad: Not a lot is really bad about this hotel. One minor objection I had about the bathroom is that there is no convenient surface onto which one can place personal travel items, such as a shaving kit. The small glass shelf under the mirror is inadequate for that. Alternatives include bringing the chair into the bathroom or placing the shaving gear on the floor. As with any European lodging, if you like to bathe with a wash cloth, bring your own from home. If you come from a country outside the euro zone, you have the option of paying the bill in your home currency by credit card through a service called Elavon. I researched this and do not recommend it. The exchange rate is unfavorable, and Elavon has a 3.5% additional markup. For me it was less expensive to just pay my card provider's currency conversion fee, or of course to pay in cash. For me the positives far outweigh any negatives about Hotel Ambiente. It was a good value for the price, and I would definitely consider another stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Charming”
Reviews.Author: NomadYuma
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the hotel in May 2011. We found it excellent value. We appreciated an early check-in and a room with a balcony. The staff was friendly and helpful. Location is a short 5 min. Walk to the S and U-Bahn station through a pleasant neighborhood. The buffet breakfast is excellent with a wide variety of fruits, cereal, pastries, breads and cheeses. It also has an elevator. We would recommend the Ambiente to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Dave6705
Reviews.Content: This is a great little find. I have stayed here three times. It is quiet, the rooms are scrupulously clean and they have a decent breakfast. I'd go as far as to say I've never stayed anywhere cleaner. It's not luxury but neither is the price. The beds are very comfortable and so are the bathrooms. The staff are courteous (although their English varies but you can communicate okay) and the location is great. Seriously, if you are not wanting to spend a fortune and want somewhere comfortable and really clean and cozy, you can't go past this place.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Arti57
Reviews.Content: Location and cleanliness of the hotel is good. However I want to share my unfortunate experience with you. On the first day of my visit ,my money was stolen from my room. When I came to my room , I saw that my money had gone. My credit cards, GPS and mobile phone was not stolen. I am %100 sure that I did not lose or droped it, because my local banknots had gone as well. I was lucky that only my money was stolen.When I went to reception to tell this robbery, they just protected their staff. They just said they were SORRY!!!. In the morning the reception called me to visit them. I suppose that they were afraid that I would run away, and they asked my to pay for the room. Ofcourse they were worried of being not paid but they should consider the rights and safety of their guests as well. I did not report to the police , because I was visiting Berlin for 3 days, and I did not want to ruin my remaining holiday. If you will stay this hotel WATCH OUT your money.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Uri9
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 6 days at this great hotel. The position was good - lots of restaurants nearby, The room was very comfortable and the bathroom sparkling. The breakfast had a great variety and was most enjoyable. The staff were all very pleasant. A computer with internet was provided for the guests next to reception.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel2008delhi
Reviews.Content: This is a great place. Its basic but very clean and well - located. The room I stayed in was very tiny but the space was utilised such that one did not feel claustrophobic. My room had a manual safe deposit box built into the wardrobe, IDD facility, free Internet access and a hair dryer (though the last two may not be in all rooms). There is a lift, though one has to climb 4 steep steps to reach the lift (which the hotel was careful to inform me of before taking my booking). The location is safe and residential with lots of restaurants about 1 minute walk away and also very close to Ku'damm (not walking distance). The hotel is at the end of a small street which tends to be deserted at night, but that is only because there are no commercial properties on the street. The restaurants in the area are generally open till late. I dealt with 3 receptionists, 2 of whom were great. 1 of them did not speak any English at all, but fortunately I did not have to deal with her at check in or check out.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: bazfly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, our first visit to Berlin. The hotel is in a quiet residential area with little traffic. There are several restaurants nearby and it's a short walk to the U and S Bahn (five minutes to Potsdammer Platz). The hotel seems to have been refurbished recently with new furniture - nice firm beds - new bathroom fittings, and is clean and bright. Reception staff were friendly and there is free internet access from a terminal in the hall. Breakfast was served in a large airy breakfast room and featured the usual orange juice, rolls, bread, cereals, cold cuts and cheeses, boiled eggs, plus very good coffee that was always hot and fresh and a samovar of boiling water with a selection of teas. Many rooms overlook the tree-filled garden at the rear and some have balconies. We had a very good deal on the room rate booking through the hotel website. Highly recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: Ambiente Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gossowstrasse 11, 10777 Berlin, Germany
